name: DN1210-037 ITP Wetland 2 Outlet Rip Rap
template name: DN1210-037 ITP Wetland 2 Outlet Rip Rap Rev 1

name: SECTION 3 – PRE-CONSTRUCTION HOLD POINTS - MATERIALS, PERSONELL & THIRD PARTY APPROVALS

Detail - The Contractor shall submit the construction and QA methodology, for each element of Earthworks, incl construction, Site Access, dewatering, wet weather, testing, inspection and hold points for review and approval prior to works.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Earthworks
Detail - Confirmation from Ecology that earthworks can proceed
Verifying Document - Email from Ecology NZ
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Earthworks
Detail - Confirm that Erosion and Sedimentation Controls are in place prior to earthworks proceeding
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Earthworks
Detail - Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Visual inspection by Engineer
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Earthworks
Detail - Site check for service features, any required design amendments to be resolved on site
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Visual inspection by Engineer
Verifying Document - Engineer notified of design amendments to be resolved
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Earthworks
SECTION 4 - IMPORTED MATERIAL TESTING - ALL TESTS TO BE NO OLDER THAN 3 MONTHS
4.1 - D50 = 250mm Rip Rap rock testing - Weathering Index of Coarse Aggregate
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.11 - The Weathering Quality Index of Coarse Aggregate
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - AA to CA
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
4.2 - D50 = 250mm Rip rap rock testing - Crushing Resistance of Course Aggregate
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.10 - The Crushing Resistance of Coarse Aggregate Under a Specified Load
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
4.3 - D50 = 250mm Rip rap rock testing - Solid Density of Aggregate
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.7.1 - The Solid Density of Aggregate Particles
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - ≥ 2.65 tonnes per m3
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.8.2 - Grading of Aggregates by method of dry sieving.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Sieve Size || % Passing
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Percentage Passing %50
4.5 - Rip rap rock testing - Point Load Strength
Detail - ASTM-D5731: 2017, Standard Test Method for Determination of the Point Load Strength Index of Rock and Application to Rock Strength Classifications
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
4.6 - Rip rap rock testing - UCS Rock
Detail - AS4133.4.2.1: 2022, Method 4.2.1: Rock strength tests – Determination of uniaxial compressive strength
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
Detail - The Contractor shall submit the full details of the filter fabric they propose to use to the Engineer for approval prior to installation. Class C & Filtration Class 1
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Results to Engineer for Approval
SECTION 5 - Imported/Site Won Material Testing - ALL TESTS TO BE NO OLDER THAN 3 MONTHS
5.1.1 - Site topsoil - Laboratory Testing for Soil Suitability
Detail - Soil Test Results from Hill Laboratories to confirm that topsoil suitable to for reuse
○ Nutrient Levels of nitrogen, available phosphorus, available potassium and available magnesium
○ Check for Toxic or Hazardous substances
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 10 equal samples taken from site, mixed together, then 1kg of soil sealed into a plastic bag and sent to lab for sampling
6.1.1 - Foundation / Subgrade Suitability - Free of organics / unsuitable material
Detail - Undercut all organic, soft, or unsuitable soils to below subgrade
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post contouring
Detail - Scala testing to meet requirements of Project Specification for cut subgrade
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 3 blows per 100mm penetration
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 4 tests per 400m2
Detail - Shear vane testing to meet requirements of Project Specification for cut subgrade
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Average minimum SU > 60kPA
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 4 tests per 400m2
Detail - Engineer to complete visual inspection of subgrade and review scala testing. Where directed by the Engineer, the unsuitable subgrade soils shall be undercut and/or improved.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Every 20m chainage on all major contours
6.2.1 - Rip Rap Lined Gully - Placement of Geotextile Fabric
Detail - Place Geotextile Fabric Strength Class C (AS440) & Flitration Class 1 across pavement area, with 500mm overlaps
Verifying Document - Visual Inspection and photos
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Before Rip Rap Placement
6.2.2 - Rip Rap Lined Gully - Check Levels
Detail - Confirm that the rip rap is an average thickness of 600mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - String lines - or equivalent
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Every 20m chainage on all major contours
6.2.3 - Rip Rap Lined Gully - Shape/Placement of Rip Rap Rcok and Contoured Adjacent Land
Detail - Shape/placement of the rip rap and in relation to the existing ground level and the contoured land adjacent to the rip rap footprint
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post Rip Rap Placement
Detail - Reinstate topsoil to existing ground levels pre construction in areas where contouring has not occurred. In areas where contouring has occurred topsoil should be 300mm in thickness
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - String lines - or equivalent
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post topsoil placmenet

Detail - As-Built records and drawings shall accurately record the layout and extents of all the work including all of the cuts and fills, monitoring instrumentation, ground improvements, and locations of foundation / subsurface drainage systems and their outlets.
Verifying Document - Survey Records/ Redpen markups
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Post Earthworks
